definition: prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
woman who looks after small children/(old) female tutor
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: But Armstrong dismissed the idea outright.
sentences.chinese: 但是阿姆斯特朗却完全否认此种说法。
阿姆斯特朗，你让我情何以堪。
奥尔德林转向阿姆斯特朗。

sentences.english: And so he published his results around 1853.
sentences.chinese: 阿姆斯特朗在1853年前后发表了他的发现。

sentences.english: I will also think about Armstrong's first moonwalk.
sentences.chinese: 我也想到了阿姆斯特朗第一次月球漫步。

sentences.english: Armstrong was given only a fifty -fifty chance of survival.
sentences.chinese: 阿姆斯特朗是在芝加哥成的名。

sentences.english: Amstrong received the order to cut the flight short.
sentences.chinese: 阿姆斯特朗接到缩短航程的指令。

sentences.english: Armstrong moved carefully away from the Eagle .
sentences.chinese: 阿姆斯特朗小心地离开了“飞鹰”号。

sentences.english: Armstrong looked round at his classmates, silly glee in profile.
sentences.chinese: 阿姆斯特朗四下里打量着同学们，露出傻笑的侧影。

sentences.english: Ist mit Ihrer Frau alles in Ordnung?" erkundigte sich Armstrong."
sentences.chinese: “您太太都好吗？”阿姆斯特朗问。
